title: shasan
author: shasan
content: The user DewlanceVPS has 100 merits on his/her profile. But the user has only 49 activities and the user is on jr member rank. So I thought we got an excellent poster who has received more merit than post/activity. Then I visited his/her merit history both on his/her profile as well as BPIP and I came to know that the user has not received any single merit all the merit came from the airdrop. Based on the merit the user should be a full member and the post should be 120 or more. In this case I think the user has deleted a lots of posts either it might be for changing hands or something else.

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: Alright so where's the part if DewlanceVPS did suspicious activity? there's nothing wrong if someone want to delete his post, it just wasting their time, but it's up to the user. It remind me with BobLawblaw who delete his post even though his merit already 3K+, but due to lack of activity he become a member rank, but right now he keep posting and back to legendary rank again.Did DewlanceVPS scam you? does he's trying to scam or did any other suspicious activity?

comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.body: Quote from: shasan on November 20, 2022, 03:09:14 AMThe user DewlanceVPS has 100 merits on his/her profile. But the user has only 49 activities and the user is on jr member rank. So I thought we got an excellent poster who has received more merit than post/activity. Then I visited his/her merit history both on his/her profile as well as BPIP and I came to know that the user has not received any single merit all the merit came from the airdrop. Based on the merit the user should be a full member and the post should be 120 or more. In this case I think the user has deleted a lots of posts either it might be for changing hands or something else.I don't see any evidence for the change of hands because the user is promoting his service in 2013 and in 2022 so if the account changed hands then probably the company also sold along?Also bpip doesn't show any records of change of password, email it only shows the wokeup after a long gap and deleting his own post is upto the user who made it so it can't be suspicious unless he tried to scam someone and deleted the post to remove the evidence.

comments.author: Pandu Geddon
comments.body: Quote from: shasan on November 20, 2022, 03:09:14 AM In this case I think the user has deleted a lots of posts either it might be for changing hands or something else.so far I don't think there has been any suspicious activity from the account. if we look at the history posts made after Woke Up, he is still active to offer services. I haven't seen any suspicions the account has changed hands.several times the account created threads on local Indian boards. but after Woke Up, he hasn't made a post in the local thread yet.as long as no member is deceived by the service he provides, I think it's still normal.

comments.author: saxydev
comments.body: Ah so sad, OP is afraid dewlancevps will steal his place as a spammer with gambling signature ;( I feel sad for him!

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.created_time: November 20, 2022, 07:10:15 AMLast edit: November 20, 2022, 09:50:15 AM by Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: shasan on November 20, 2022, 03:09:14 AMIn this case I think the user has deleted a lots of posts either it might be for changing hands or something else.He could have deleted his posts for myriad of reasons, that alone is no proof Â that there is something fishy going on. Regarding possibility of the account changing hands, I see that he is promoting his web hosting business since 2013 up until few days ago, so there is some consistency here.

comments.author: JollyGood
comments.body: I would say that deleting post history does not provide any concrete evidence at all that something untoward has occurred but it is because of threads such as this one that we can get together and look at the account in question to pass on opinions therefore thank you for posting about it.Granted, they are not prolific posters in the forum but they have their account dating back to 2012. In my opinion there seems to be nothing substantial to indicate the account has changed hands, on the contrary they seem to be promoting their business when they do post and there seems to be nothing to be alarmed about.Quote from: shasan on November 20, 2022, 03:09:14 AMThe user DewlanceVPS has 100 merits on his/her profile. But the user has only 49 activities and the user is on jr member rank. So I thought we got an excellent poster who has received more merit than post/activity. Then I visited his/her merit history both on his/her profile as well as BPIP and I came to know that the user has not received any single merit all the merit came from the airdrop. Based on the merit the user should be a full member and the post should be 120 or more. In this case I think the user has deleted a lots of posts either it might be for changing hands or something else.

comments.author: Falconer
comments.body: Quote from: shasan on November 20, 2022, 03:09:14 AMIn this case I think the user has deleted a lots of posts either it might be for changing hands or something else.You might be right about the reason, he deleted his post which made his rank drop to Jr member because his activity points loss. After all, deleting a post is not a reason to suspect a user has changed hands, I think this kind of thing can still be done by every user in this forum as long as they think the post is not important.Also I don't see bpip noting this account changed its email and password recently so any suspicion of the account changing hands at this point is very unlikely. About account above, I think he's still the same user without too much suspicion about it on my part. But if he cheats on you, then he should face the consequences.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Quote from: shasan on November 20, 2022, 03:09:14 AMThe user DewlanceVPS has 100 merits on his/her profile. But the user has only 49 activities and the user is on jr member rank. So I thought we got an excellent poster who has received more merit than post/activity. Then I visited his/her merit history both on his/her profile as well as BPIP and I came to know that the user has not received any single merit all the merit came from the airdrop. Based on the merit the user should be a full member and the post should be 120 or more. In this case I think the user has deleted a lots of posts either it might be for changing hands or something else.shasan, there doesn't seem to be anything suspicious about that account even though he actually deleted lot of his posts. Of course we don't know why this user deleted the post, but he has the right to do so on his own. DewlanceVPS may have realized that his account rating would drop after he deleted the post, but it looks like he didn't delete it recently as there's a chance he did it a long time ago.One of my reasons is that Ninjastic.space has only recorded 47 posts from this user in its history. If he deleted them recently, maybe the number of posts scraped on Tryninja tool would be higher than his current post count.

comments.author: Awaklara
comments.body: Quote from: shasan on November 20, 2022, 03:09:14 AMThe user DewlanceVPS has 100 merits on his/her profile. But the user has only 49 activities and the user is on jr member rank. Based on the merit the user should be a full member and the post should be 120 or more. In this case I think the user has deleted a lots of posts either it might be for changing hands or something else.I hope you don't do business with him. if you consider there is a possibility that the account has changed hands.there is no evidence to support this allegation. but indeed an account that has been sleeping for a very long time suddenly woke up. maybe he just wants to get on with the business he's doing.if you don't trust the account I guess you should just ignore it.

comments.author: shasan
comments.body: Almost all the comments are of the same opinion. I have also not found anything that's why I have posted on a reputed board. If I could find out anything then I could update it. Anyway, the post has been removed so before making any deal we should be aware especially if we see a writing style change or password change. I am locking the thread. If anyone wants to post any updates just message me I will unlock it.
